headline: Expedia Shares Fall After Weak Demand Trends Hurt Results
summary: Expedia Group posted higher sales in the first-quarter, which came in below Wall Street expectations as results were hurt by what Chief Executive Ariane Gorin said was weaker-than-expected demand in the U.S.

raw.headline: Expedia Shares Fall After Weak Demand Trends Hurt Results
raw.summary: Expedia Group posted higher sales in the first-quarter, which came in below Wall Street expectations as results were hurt by what Chief Executive Ariane Gorin said was weaker-than-expected demand in the U.S.

headline: Expedia (EXPE) Misses Q1 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Expedia (EXPE) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -4.76% and 1.27%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

raw.headline: Expedia (EXPE) Misses Q1 Earnings and Revenue Estimates

headline: Expedia Stock Falls On Mixed Q1. Travel Site Warns Of 'Weaker Than Expected' U.S. Demand
summary: Expedia said it is seeing "weaker than expected" U.S. travel demand. Expedia stock fell after mixed Q1 results.

raw.headline: Expedia Stock Falls On Mixed Q1. Travel Site Warns Of 'Weaker Than Expected' U.S. Demand
raw.summary: Expedia said it is seeing "weaker than expected" U.S. travel demand. Expedia stock fell after mixed Q1 results.

headline: Expedia: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: SEATTLE (AP) — Expedia Inc. EXPE) on Thursday reported a loss of $200 million in its first quarter. The Seattle-based company said it had a loss of $1.56 per share.

raw.headline: Expedia: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: SEATTLE (AP) — Expedia Inc. EXPE) on Thursday reported a loss of $200 million in its first quarter. The Seattle-based company said it had a loss of $1.56 per share.

headline: Expedia misses quarterly revenue estimates amid weak US travel demand; shares down
summary: Demand in the U.S. softened as Americans grew wary about discretionary spending, especially on big-ticket expenses such as travel, due to the economic uncertainty caused by an erratic trade policy.  Strength in international travel, especially in Asia-Pacific and Europe, has helped travel companies offset some slowing travel in the U.S.

headline: Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) Misses Q1 Sales Targets
summary: Online travel agency Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025 as sales rose 3.4% year on year to $2.99 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.40 per share was 11.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Expedia Group Reports First Quarter 2025 Results
